skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.

An ungainly mechanical construct powered by rusted gears and warpstone, this device has a mount for the Tidesqueaker and emits thick clouds of sea-scented steam.Although prone to sudden malfunctions, its clattering movements and exhaust puffs lend an intimidating presence to the battlefield.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

stat_effects.description: x0.025 Dealt Collision Knocked Back Threshold
x0.022 Dealt Collision Knocked Down Threshold
x0.02 Dealt Collision Knocked Flying Threshold

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Calling upon the dark tides, the Tidesqueaker summons a sudden, crushing wave of saltwater, making the ground slick and difficult to traverse. Enemies caught in the riptide are disoriented, their defenses lowered and their movements slowed.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: The Tidesqueaker curses his foes with a corrosive hex, encrusting their flesh and armor in salty scabs. This mystical ailment causes continual harm and leaves victims more vulnerable to attacks.
When fully charged with magical energy, the Tidesqueaker enhances everyone around him with the fury of the deep sea, the rage of the kraken against those who dwell upon the surface.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: Certain of the undead rats display such a connection with the deep places of the ocean that they can help the Skabrus sail through the darkness with almost no mishaps whatsoever. And sometimes along the way, pick up some of their friends.

effects.description: Upkeep: -5% for Animated Hulks, Bloated Corpse, Syreens, Rotting Prometheans, Rotting Prometheans Gunnery Mob, Mournguls, Rotting Leviathan and Necrofex Colossus units

skillTree.localised_description: With dark rituals and whispered curses, the Tidesqueaker reduces the effort required to call upon the deep, casting more frequently and with less strain on his reserves.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for overcast spells

skillTree.localised_description: Mastery over putrid waters allows the Tidesqueaker to infuse his magic with corrosive properties. His spells and attacks erode both flesh and armor, wearing down enemies with poisonous touch and relentless force.

effects.description: Enables "Touch of Corruption!" contact effect (damage over time)

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Sheer, undiluted spite sharpens the dead eye further.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Spiteful Shot"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spiteful Shot Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spiteful Shot Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: No matter how far away, none can escape the Kiss of the Deep, nor breathe again with lungs full of seawater.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Tidecall Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: All manner of creatures infest the deep, many who have never - and should never - be seen above the waves.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Rotting Prometheans

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Denizens of the Deep"

skillTree.localised_description: As surely as night follows day, when the mist descends, death isn't far behind.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Fog of the Damned Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Fog of the Damned Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Fog of the Damned"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Fog of the Damned Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Fog of the Damned Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Once the mighty Kraken's tentacles take hold, only the toughest can fight their way free.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Kraken's Pull"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Kraken's Pull Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Kraken's Pull Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: No one sails this ship of fools.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Vangheist's Revenge"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Vangheist's Revenge Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Vangheist's Revenge Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Skaven corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Skaven corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Skaven corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sheer, undiluted spite sharpens the dead eye further.
"I keep them sharp, yes-yes. Always ready for the challenge that I know is coming, yes-yes!"
"When they come for you, go straight for the throat and tear it clean out. They won't come again."

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +50% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Most precious of all substances, the pulse of our life."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -12% for Warpfire Thrower, Warp Lightning Cannon and Doomwheel units
	(all units in army)

Construction cost: -10% for Engineering buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +25%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
